title: Getting Started with bupaR
text: bupaverse (alias bupaR (Janssenswillen et al. 2019)) open-source, integrated suite R-packages (R Core Team 2022) handling analysing business process data, developed Business Informatics Research Group Hasselt University, Belgium. Profoundly inspired tidyverse (Wickham et al. 2019) package, bupaverse package designed facilitate installation loading multiple bupaverse packages single step.

title: Getting Started with bupaR
text: bupaverse collection packages can conveniently installed CRAN using single R command: install “core” packages required start business process analytics R. Currently, “core” contains following packages: bupaR: Core package business process analysis. edeaR: Exploratory descriptive analysis event based data. eventdataR: Repository sample process data. processcheckR: Rule-based conformance checking filtering. processmapR: Visualise event based data using, .., process maps. start using packages, can load using single R command: addition attaching “core” packages, command also reports package versions loaded conflicts previously loaded packages. install.packages("bupaverse") also installs “non-core” packages required bupaverse function. “non-core” packages include: cli (Csárdi 2022), glue (Hester Bryan 2022), magrittr (Bache Wickham 2022), purrr (Henry Wickham 2022a), rlang (Henry Wickham 2022b). Note packages attached library(bupaverse).

title: Getting Started with bupaR
text: bupaverse development team like warmly thank users actively contributing bupaverse framework submitting issues pull requests GitHub repositories.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gerard van Hulzen. Author. Gert Janssenswillen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Janssenswillen G, Depaire B, Swennen M, Jans MJ, Vanhoof K (2019). “bupaR: Enabling Reproducible Business Process Analysis.” Knowledge-Based Systems, 163, 1857. doi:10.1016/j.knosys.2018.10.018.
